reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here last week on a trip to Adelaide. This motel is very basic. We were in an executive room which is to the side and rear of the motel. We asked for a rear room to try and avoid traffic noise from the highway-this was not too bad. The room was large, much larger than other motel rooms I have stayed in, was very clean, but is in need of refurbishment. There were cracks in the tiles in the entry way and bathroom, rust type stains in the toilet and the furniture has marks on it. The cost of $125 for the night was, we felt, a bit steep for what you got. Breakfast was continental style (not included in the tariff) and delivered to the room the night before (the bread for the toast was frozen). Would stay somewhere else next time.
reviews.title: OK!

reviews.text: Fast friendly service. Clean rooms, a hot shower and a tv thats not fuzzy, what more would you need for an overnight stay. Would recommend to anyone traveling through Bordertown. Meals in the resturant are very reasonably priced, try the warm beef salad....it's amazing.
reviews.title: Great priced clean rooms for an overnight stay.

reviews.text: I use this motel frequently for business. The staff are friendly and the rooms clean. I usually eat in the restaurant which has great food, probably the best in Bordertown. I would recomend this motel for anybody seeking reasonably priced acomodation when passing through Bordertown.
reviews.title: A place to park the car and stay for the night

reviews.text: A room to stay for the night, tea in the restaurant was ok, overpriced through the roof though, left room door open while bringing stuff in from car and a cat found it's way into my room, some sort of flying bugs in the room although I used the complimentary insect spray to take care of them,, cracks in the walls, beds need urgent attention and all up rooms are very well dated, they are a part of the golden chain motels although in this case the only chain this motel belongs on is a rusty one. I would not stay here again.
reviews.title: Old but clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A welcome stay on a very rainy night. On the outskirts of the town, there were three qualities of room available, we chose the middle one (about $100 for one night). It was clean and warm once the heating had kicked in. A reasonable place for an overnight stay. The WIFI worked well (at a price slightly higher than normal for this facility)
reviews.title: Average

reviews.text: Just passing thru, stayed in one of the older rooms for a cheap price, had everything but no power point for the kettle to plug into easy.
reviews.title: Ok for overnight

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would say average for a motel in the country.
reviews.title: A bit like Fawlty Towers

likes.liked: — Waking up the following morning, knowing I was leaving

reviews.text: I arrived mid afternoon, the staff were very friendly and hospitable upon check in. I had a swim then went and had dinner and what a dinner. The lamb Valentine was the best meal I have ever had, away from home. I am away every week and stay at the Sofitel and Marriott motels whilst in the major cities and honestly that meal out did anything I can rememeber. i highly recommend Dukes Motor Inn. The owner David and his lovely wife and daughter deserve a pat on the back.
reviews.title: A Great night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found the motel to be overall, very reasonable. Took a room furtherest from the highway to minimise noise. Unlike some others we found reception staff quite ok & I dont really know what the problem paying the night before is anyway - afterall you only have to pay once & you can take off when you wish. Food was quite good value in the restaurant
reviews.title: reasonable value

reviews.text: A family owned business, as in Ädams"family. This place defies discription. The reception bordered on obscene, rude, impatient, didnt know what she was doing. Cats were everywhere in dining room, and my wife seen a cat laying on a set dining room table. The bathroom was filthy. The food was the only highlight, beautifully cooked and presented and the waitress was great. The family constantly bickered all night, whilst watching bad TV, in the dining room. We were rushed out as the family wanted to close.
reviews.title: NEVER AGAIN

reviews.text: I had presumed the first requirement in the hospitality industry is to be hospitable.
reviews.title: Okay for a night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our host was a little remiss.
reviews.title: LIke everyone else says, ok for an overnight
